3. لِ is a preposition meaning "belongs to", for example: 

This belongs to Bilal and that belongs to Hamid.
هَذَا  لِبِلاَلٍ، وَدَلِكَ  لِحَامِدٍ

Praise belongs to Allah
الحَمْدُ  لِلَّهِ

 Note that the word اللَّهُ becomes لِلَّهِ lillah-i(belongs to Allah) by just dropping the alif. No lam need to be added to the word.
لِمَنْ means "whose" or "belongs to whom" e.g.

Whose is this?(Whom does this belongs to?)
لِمَنْ هَذَا 

Whose is the book?
 ?لِمَنِ  الكِتَابُ

Note that مَنْ becomes مَنِ when followed by اَلْ 

4. أَيْضًا means "also", e.g.

This is beautifull,
هَذَا  جَمِيْلٌ

and that is also beautifull.
 وَذَلِكَ  أَيْضًا  جَمِيْلٌ 

5. جِدًّا means "very", e.g.

This is very big
هَذَا  كَبِيْرٌ  جِدًّا
